meanings.definition: The act of waking from sleep or becoming alert again.
meanings.sent1: After the loud noise, his rearousals were frequent throughout the night.
meanings.sent2: The rearousals of the baby were always accompanied by a cute yawn.
meanings.sent3: The rearousals of the cat were so sudden, they always made me jump!
meanings.sent4: Her rearousals in the morning were like a flower blooming in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The rearousals of the bear from hibernation were a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The process of stirring or arousing someone from a state of inactivity or rest.
meanings.sent1: The rearousals of the audience during the concert were a sign of a great performance.
meanings.sent2: The rearousals of the students after the break signaled the start of the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The rearousals of the dog from its nap were always accompanied by a stretch.
meanings.sent4: Her rearousals of interest in the project were a welcome change.
meanings.sent5: The rearousals of the city from its slumber were marked by the hustle and bustle of morning.
